Class BowlingGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • BowlingGame

  • public class BowlingGame
extends java.lang.Object
    Purpose: The BowlingGame program is designed to compute the score of a player's Bowling Game. Constructors: BowlingGame Methods: shot, getFrame, toString, computeScoreFrame, computScore, getScore
    Since:
    2018-01-27
    Author:
    Robert Williams

    • Method Detail

      • shot

        public boolean shot(int p)
        Purpose: The shot method determines if the bowler has another shot left in the frame. Rules: If the frame is 1-9, then a Strike will increment the frame and the bowler will not have another shot in the frame. If frame is 10, then a strike on the first shot enables two additional shots. In frame 10, a spare on the second shot will allow a third shot.
        Parameters:
        p - The number of pins knocked down on the shot.
        Returns:
        A boolean if the bowler has another shot.

      • getFrame

        public int getFrame()
        Purpose: The getFrame method is the getter method for the frame variable.
        Parameters:
        nothing -
        Returns:
        an int representing the value of the current frame

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Purpose: The toString method returns a String message containing the bowler's name, frame, strikes, spares, gutterBalls, and score after each frame.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        nothing -
        Returns:
        a String message with attributes about the bowler's game

      • computeScoreFrame

        public void computeScoreFrame()
        Purpose: The computeScoreFrame method computes the bowler's score after each frame. Scoring Rules: Strikes: 10 points in the current frame plus score from next two shots Spares: 10 points in the current frame plus score from next shot only For Example: If a strike is bowled in frame 1, 10 points are awarded. Then, if the next two shots are 2 and 5, 7 points are added to frame 1, and 7 points are added to the resulting score from frame 1 for a total score of 24 points after frame 2. If a spare is bowled in frame 1, 10 points are awarded. Then, if the next shot is a 2, 2 points are added to frame 1, and 2 points are added to the resulting score from frame 1 for a total score of 14 points after frame 2.
        Parameters:
        nothing -

      • computeScore

        public void computeScore()
        Purpose: The computeScore method computes the bowler's score after each the game has finished. It is similar to the computeScoreFrame method except it computes the score once all of the frames have been finished. Scoring Rules: Strikes: 10 points in the current frame plus score from next two shots Spares: 10 points in the current frame plus score from next shot only For Example: If a strike is bowled in frame 1, 10 points are awarded. Then, if the next two shots are 2 and 5, 7 points are added to frame 1, and 7 points are added to the resulting score from frame 1 for a total score of 24 points after frame 2. If a spare is bowled in frame 1, 10 points are awarded. Then, if the next shot is a 2, 2 points are added to frame 1, and 2 points are added to the resulting score from frame 1 for a total score of 14 points after frame 2.
        Parameters:
        nothing -

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Purpose: The getScore method is the getter method for the score variable.
        Parameters:
        nothing -
        Returns:
        an int representing the bowler's current score;
